Code API¶

CoreData¶

core_data.DEFAULT_MODEL_GROUP = '_default_models'¶

Default model group name, used for types and instances.

core_data.DEFAULT_TEMPLATE_GROUP = '_default_templates'¶

Default template group name, used for types and instances.

class core_data.DataCore¶

Class where everything is kept.

Todo

Create exceptions

add_model_type_to_group(group_name: str, model, auto_create_group=True)¶

Add a model type to a group.

If auto_create_group is true and the group doesn’t exist it will be created. If false an exception will be raised.

Parameters

  • group_name (str) – Name of the group

  • model (Model) – Model to be added

  • auto_create_group (bool) – If the group should be created if it doesn’t exist

Raises

DuplicatedModelTypeName – If there’s a model with the supplied name inside the group

get_model_type(name: str, group: str = '_default_models')¶

Get model type from the group

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of the model type to get

  • group (str) – Name of the group

get_model_type_group(name: str)¶

Get model. It will raise an exception if the group doesn’t exist.

Parameters

name (str) – The name of the group

Raises

ModelTypeGroupNotFound – If then group doesn’t exist.

get_or_create_model_type_group(name: str)¶

Get a group of model types, if it doesn’t exist, the group is created.

Parameters

name (string) – name of the group

Exceptions¶

exception core_data.custom_exceptions.DuplicatedModelTypeName¶

Exception raised if a Model Type already exists with the same name inside the group.

exception core_data.custom_exceptions.ModelTypeGroupNotFound¶

Exception raised if the Model Type Group is not found.

exception core_data.custom_exceptions.ModelTypeNotFound¶

Exception raised if the Model Group is not found.
